author: cacknin
msg: Fix some repos/wc discrepancies and add two repos/repos tests.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/diff.c:
(include apr_md5.h to calculate file checksums)
(transmit_prop_deltas): new function to help dump property changes
editor commands, in repos/wc diffs.
(svnpatch_delete_entry): test reverse_order before writing command.
(path_driver_cb_func): wrap a call to svnpatch_delete_entry with a
fancy workaround.
(add_directory): fix token creation and make use of reverse_order to
deduce between add or del.
(close_directory, close_file): make use of transmit_prop_deltas.
(close_file): overwrite the text_checksum argument with a new one we
calculate with svn_io_file_checksum against base-text or temp file.
(add_file): check against reverse_order too, for accuracy.
(change_dir_prop, change_file_prop): remove calls to diff_editor
functions; we're doing this in close_directory and close_file now
since we need some processing before being able to choose the right
direction.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/diff_tests.py:
(diff_svnpatch): a two repos/repos tests, and fix some previous
repos/wc tests.

author: sage
msg: Add list method and supporting methods to python ctypes WC class. Allows the user
access to the svn_client_list function, as well as supporting callbacks.
* (csvn/wc.py):
(__init__): Add code to set up callbacks.
(_list_wrapper): Private method to wrap user callbacks
(set_list_func): Method to allow the user to set the callback to be used.
(list): Method to call the list callback with information about items.

author: ehu
msg: Introduce diff/merge option support for in-memory data diffing/merging.
Finishes issue #2865 and opens up the way for resolution of issue #1493.
* subversion/include/svn_diff.h
(svn_diff_file_options_t): Note that this type is also used for
in-memory diff/merge.
* subversion/include/svn_diff.h
* subversion/libsvn_diff/diff_memory.c
(svn_diff_mem_string_diff,
svn_diff_mem_string_diff3,
svn_diff_mem_string_diff4): Add the options parameter.  Calculate and
allocate normalization buffers.
* subversion/libsvn_diff/diff_memory.c
(mem_baton_t): Add options parameter and pointers to 2 normalization buffers.
(data_source_get_next_token): Normalize before calculating the hash.
(token_compare): Normalize before comparing lengths and contents.
(alloc_normalization_bufs): Calculate the maximum size of a normalized token
to prevent memory re-allocation.
* subversion/libsvn_diff/diff-diff3-test.c
(two_way_diff, three_way_merge): No longer test in-memory operations
conditionally.  They support options now.

author: ehu
msg: Followup to r26049: Fix libsvn_diff breakage with normalized diff/merge.
* subversion/libsvn_diff/diff_file.c
(svn_diff__file_token_t::norm_offset): Add field to record start of
the normalized token.
(datasource_get_next_token): Set the norm_offset after normalizing.
Also, calculate the hash based on the location of the *normalized* data.
(token_compare): If the token is in-memory, calculate its position in
the buffer based on the norm_offset.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_diff/diff-diff3-test.c
(test_three_way_merge_no_overlap): Add a test-case for the observed breakage.

author: hwright
msg: JavaHL: Actually use the ignoreMimeTypes parameter for svn_client_blame3().
* subversion/bindings/javahl/native/SVNClient.cpp
(blame): The caller provides an ignoreMimeTypes value, so lets use it to
call the client library.
